main event: A series of unidentified flying objects were observed during routine air activity at Congaree AFB and Shaw AFB, South Carolina, on 7th March 1953.
interesting points: The objects did not correspond to conventional aircraft or meteorological phenomena.
The objects were observed to be bright, luminous, and traveling at a fast pace over a stretch of approximately 101 miles.
Multiple witnesses from different Air Force Bases, including LANGLEY AFB, VA and POPE AFB, N.C., reported observing the unidentified flying objects.
No evidence of conventional aircraft or meteorological phenomena was found.
The report was initially classified as unidentified and was downgraded at 3-year intervals, eventually being declassified after 12 years.
location: Congaree AFB and Shaw AFB, South Carolina
witnesses: Multiple Air Force personnel from different Air Force Bases
photographs: no photographs included in the report
